poem:
Title: "On Summons & Silver"

In bonds and fines the tale unwinds,
a half-billion dollar hurly-burly.
Denial reigns in castle walls -
once mighty, now barely sturdy.
Son speaks in tongues of lost funds,
Whispers, "They don't exist!"
Shadow of a ticking clock,
a potter's field persist.
Hall of mirrors, none the clearer,
The charge remains unresisted.
